pageContent:
Nestor Leo
Cell: (908)267-0016
Leo11mbm@gmail.com
Professional summary:
Data analyst with specialty in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server. Five years of valuable hands-
on  experience  in  fast  paced  business  environments.  Exhibits  excellent  customer-oriented 
problem-solving skills.
Highlights 
Over   5   years   of   overall   experience   with   Tableau   and   Excel   in   Reporting   in   various 
Organizations.
Worked on different tableau versions 
Combined  multiple  data  sources  using  blending  in  Tableau  to  keep  track  of  sensor  data, 
operator inputs, and real-time systems all in one dashboard.
Preparing Dashboards using calculations, parameters in Tableau
Excellent  knowledge  in  various  reporting  objects  like  Attributes,  Hierarchies,  filters,  prompts, 
Calculated fields, Sets, Groups, Parameters, Level-of-Detail (LOD) expressions etc., in Tableau.
Implemented Binning & Blending concepts in my Tableau Reports.

Calculated fields, Sets, Groups, Parameters, Level-of-Detail (LOD) expressions etc., in Tableau.
Implemented Binning & Blending concepts in my Tableau Reports.
Experience in creating different visualizations using Bars, Lines and Pies, Maps, Scatter plots, 
Gantt charts, Bubbles, Histograms, Bullets, Heat maps and Highlight tables. 
Proficient  in  design  and  development  of  various  dashboards,  reports  utilizing  advanced 
Tableau  Visualizations  like  Waterfall  Charts,  Funnel  Charts,  Pareto  Charts,  Dual  Axis, 
Blended Axes, Scatter Plots, Bar in Bar, Box Plot, Bullet Chart, Gantt Chart, Heat Map, Spark 
Line, KPI Charts.
Excellent  knowledge  on  Trend  Lines,  Statistics,  and  Log  Axes.  Groups,  hierarchies,  sets  to 
create detail level summary report.
Excellent knowledge in Tableau visual analytics and best practices like Dashboard structure, 
view orientation, Sizing and Layout, Data Emphasis, Highlighting, Color, Fonts and Tooltips.
Education:

Associates Degree in Computer Science, Middlesex  College
Tableau versions worked on
Tableau 9.3
Tableau 10.0 - 10.5
Tableau 2018.1
Tableau 2019.1 & 2
Tableau 2020.2
Tableau 2021.1
Technical skills
Tableau Desktop
Tableau Server
Tableau Prep
Excel
SQL
Java
Workday
Experience 
Elementis     May 2022 - Present
Role: Tableau Developer
Responsibilities:
Develop Tableau reports that provide clear visualizations of various industry-specific 
KPIs.
Access and transform massive datasets through filtering, grouping, aggregation, and 
statistical calculation.
Good understanding of advanced Tableau features including calculated fields, 
parameters, table calculations, row-level security, R integration, joins, data blending, 
and dashboard actions.
Created  action  filters,  parameters  and  calculated  sets  for  preparing  dashboards  and 
worksheets in Tableau. 
Design for data preparation to be consumed by Tableau Dashboards.

Restricted data for users using Row level security and User filters.
Published the developed dashboards into production and ensured the data was up to date 
by  scheduling  extract  refreshes,  performed  performance  tuning  of  the  dashboard  and 
created Tableau functional design document.
Enhanced  Daily,  Weekly  and  Monthly  reports  that  were  developed  by  using  Excel  and 
server
Safelite AutoGlass                                                                                                   May 2021 – Dec 2021                     
Data Analyst (Tableau/Workday)
Responsibilities:
Built dashboards using techniques for guided analytics, interactive dashboard design, 
and visual best practices.
Built dashboards for HR Partners and Recruiting team
Experienced in requirement gathering/analysis, design, development, testing, and 
production rollover of reporting and analysis projects.
Developing and modifying reports for management and HR Business Partners

production rollover of reporting and analysis projects.
Developing and modifying reports for management and HR Business Partners
Assist Senior Business Analysts in executing core processes surrounding the Workday 
system including Scenario testing, creating custom reports, and creating Workday 
Dashboard for HR Partners
Ensure the completeness and accuracy of HR data
Robert Wood Johnson, NJ                                                 March 2016 – Dec 2020
Tableau Developer
Responsibilities: 
Performed   Troubleshooting   of   issues   related   to   Database   Integrity,   Performance, 
Blocking & Deadlocking and Index Management 
Created Data extracts for better performance and accessing data offline.
Used parameters and input controls to give users control over certain values.
Implemented  Data  blending  with  multiple  data  sources  on  a  single  worksheet  for  data 
analysis.

Used parameters and input controls to give users control over certain values.
Implemented  Data  blending  with  multiple  data  sources  on  a  single  worksheet  for  data 
analysis.
Cleared  errors  according  to  business  requirements  excel  sheet  and  helped  to  create 
Documentation for the dashboards.

Created and Published Tableau Dashboards into Tableau Server.
Provided support for Tableau developed objects and understand tool administration.
Developed the table documentation for Tableau Dashboards.
